com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.control

Annotation Type TTableView


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value=FIELD)
public @interface TTableView
    Build a TableView
    Author:
    Davis Gordon

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      TTableColumn[] columns
      TableView Class The TableColumns that are part of this TableView.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      java.lang.Class<? extends ITControlBuilder<javafx.scene.control.TableView,ITObservableList>> builder
      The builder of type ITControlBuilder for this component.
      java.lang.Class<ITColumnResizePolicyCallBackBuilder> columnResizePolicy
      TableView Class Sets the value of the property columnResizePolicy.
      TObjectProperty columnResizePolicyProperty
      TableView Class This is the function called when the user completes a column-resize operation.
      TControl control
      The Control settings Default value: @TControl(prefWidth=250)
      boolean editable
      TableView Class Sets the value of the property editable.
      TBooleanProperty editableProperty
      TableView Class Specifies whether this TableView is editable - only if the TableView, the TableColumn (if applicable) and the TableCells within it are both editable will a TableCell be able to go into their editing state
      TReadOnlyObjectProperty editingCellProperty
      TableView Class Represents the current cell being edited, or null if there is no cell being edited
      TTableView.TTableViewFocusModel focusModel
      TableView Class Sets the value of the property focusModel.
      TObjectProperty focusModelProperty
      TableView Class Represents the currently-installed TableView.TableViewFocusModel for this TableView.
      TObjectProperty itemsProperty
      TableView Class The underlying data model for the TableView.
      TNode node
      The Node settings
      java.lang.Class<? extends ITAnnotationParser>[] parser
      The parser class for this annotation Default value: {TTableViewParser.class}
      java.lang.Class<ITNodeBuilder> placeholder
      TableView Class Sets the value of the property placeholder.
      TObjectProperty placeholderProperty
      TableView Class This Node is shown to the user when the table has no content to show.
      java.lang.Class<ITRowFactoryCallBackBuilder> rowFactory
      TableView Class Sets the value of the property rowFactory.
      TObjectProperty rowFactoryProperty
      TableView Class A function which produces a TableRow.
      TTableView.TTableViewSelectionModel selectionModel
      TableView Class Sets the value of the property selectionModel.
      TObjectProperty selectionModelProperty
      TableView Class The SelectionModel provides the API through which it is possible to select single or multiple items within a TableView, as well as inspect which items have been selected by the user.
      boolean tableMenuButtonVisible
      TableView Class Sets the value of the property tableMenuButtonVisible.
      TBooleanProperty tableMenuButtonVisibleProperty
      TableView Class This controls whether a menu button is available when the user clicks in a designated space within the TableView, within which is a radio menu item for each TableColumn in this table.

    • Element Detail

      • columns

        public abstract TTableColumn[] columns
         TableView Class
  
  The TableColumns that are part of this TableView. As the user reorders the TableView columns, 
  this list will be updated to reflect the current visual ordering.

      • builder

        public abstract java.lang.Class<? extends ITControlBuilder<javafx.scene.control.TableView,ITObservableList>> builder
         The builder of type ITControlBuilder for this component.
 
  Default value: TTableViewBuilder
        Default:
        com.tedros.fxapi.builder.TTableViewBuilder.class

      • parser

        public abstract java.lang.Class<? extends ITAnnotationParser>[] parser
         The parser class for this annotation
 
 Default value: {TTableViewParser.class}
        Default:
        com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.parser.TTableViewParser.class

      • node

        public abstract TNode node
         The Node settings
        Default:
        @com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.scene.TNode(parse=false)

      • control

        public abstract TControl control
         The Control settings
 
 Default value: @TControl(prefWidth=250)
        Default:
        @com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.scene.control.TControl(prefWidth=250.0, parse=true)

      • tableMenuButtonVisible

        public abstract boolean tableMenuButtonVisible
         TableView Class
 
  Sets the value of the property tableMenuButtonVisible. 
  
  Property description: 
  
  This controls whether a menu button is available when the user clicks in a designated 
  space within the TableView, within which is a radio menu item for each TableColumn in 
  this table. This menu allows for the user to show and hide all TableColumns easily.
  
  Default value: false
        Default:
        false

      • columnResizePolicy

        public abstract java.lang.Class<ITColumnResizePolicyCallBackBuilder> columnResizePolicy
         TableView Class
 
  Sets the value of the property columnResizePolicy. Property description: This is the function called when the user completes a column-resize operation. The two most common policies are available as static functions in the TableView class: UNCONSTRAINED_RESIZE_POLICY and CONSTRAINED_RESIZE_POLICY.
        Default:
        com.tedros.fxapi.builder.ITColumnResizePolicyCallBackBuilder.class

      • rowFactory

        public abstract java.lang.Class<ITRowFactoryCallBackBuilder> rowFactory
         TableView Class
 
  Sets the value of the property rowFactory. Property description: A function which produces a TableRow. The system is responsible for reusing TableRows. Return from this function a TableRow which might be usable for representing a single row in a TableView. Note that a TableRow is not a TableCell. A TableRow is simply a container for a TableCell, and in most circumstances it is more likely that you'll want to create custom TableCells, rather than TableRows. The primary use case for creating custom TableRow instances would most probably be to introduce some form of column spanning support. You can create custom TableCell instances per column by assigning the appropriate function to the cellFactory property in the TableColumn class.
        Default:
        com.tedros.fxapi.builder.ITRowFactoryCallBackBuilder.class

      • placeholder

        public abstract java.lang.Class<ITNodeBuilder> placeholder
         TableView Class
 
  Sets the value of the property placeholder. Property description: This Node is shown to the user when the table has no content to show. This may be the case because the table model has no data in the first place, that a filter has been applied to the table model, resulting in there being nothing to show the user, or that there are no currently visible columns.
        Default:
        com.tedros.fxapi.builder.ITNodeBuilder.class

      • selectionModel

        public abstract TTableView.TTableViewSelectionModel selectionModel
         TableView Class
 
  Sets the value of the property selectionModel. 
  
  Property description: 
  
  The SelectionModel provides the API through which it 
  is possible to select single or multiple items within 
  a TableView, as well as inspect which items have been 
  selected by the user. Note that it has a generic type 
  that must match the type of the TableView itself.
        Default:
        @com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.control.TTableView.TTableViewSelectionModel

      • focusModel

        public abstract TTableView.TTableViewFocusModel focusModel
         TableView Class
 
  Sets the value of the property focusModel. 
  
  Property description: 
  
  Represents the currently-installed TableView.TableViewFocusModel 
  for this TableView. Under almost all circumstances leaving this 
  as the default focus model will suffice.
        Default:
        @com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.control.TTableView.TTableViewFocusModel

      • editable

        public abstract boolean editable
         TableView Class
 
  Sets the value of the property editable. Property description: Specifies whether this TableView is editable - only if the TableView, the TableColumn (if applicable) and the TableCells within it are both editable will a TableCell be able to go into their editing state.
        Default:
        false

      • itemsProperty

        public abstract TObjectProperty itemsProperty
         TableView Class
 
  The underlying data model for the TableView.
        Default:
        @com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.property.TObjectProperty(parse=false)

      • tableMenuButtonVisibleProperty

        public abstract TBooleanProperty tableMenuButtonVisibleProperty
         TableView Class
 
  This controls whether a menu button is available when the user clicks in a designated space within the TableView, within which is a radio menu item for each TableColumn in this table. This menu allows for the user to show and hide all TableColumns easily
        Default:
        @com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.property.TBooleanProperty(parse=false)

      • columnResizePolicyProperty

        public abstract TObjectProperty columnResizePolicyProperty
         TableView Class
 
  This is the function called when the user completes a column-resize operation. The two most common policies are available as static functions in the TableView class: UNCONSTRAINED_RESIZE_POLICY and CONSTRAINED_RESIZE_POLICY
        Default:
        @com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.property.TObjectProperty(parse=false)

      • rowFactoryProperty

        public abstract TObjectProperty rowFactoryProperty
         TableView Class
 
  A function which produces a TableRow. The system is responsible for reusing TableRows. Return from this function a TableRow which might be usable for representing a single row in a TableView. Note that a TableRow is not a TableCell. A TableRow is simply a container for a TableCell, and in most circumstances it is more likely that you'll want to create custom TableCells, rather than TableRows. The primary use case for creating custom TableRow instances would most probably be to introduce some form of column spanning support. You can create custom TableCell instances per column by assigning the appropriate function to the cellFactory property in the TableColumn class
        Default:
        @com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.property.TObjectProperty(parse=false)

      • placeholderProperty

        public abstract TObjectProperty placeholderProperty
         TableView Class
 
  This Node is shown to the user when the table has no content to show. This may be the case because the table model has no data in the first place, that a filter has been applied to the table model, resulting in there being nothing to show the user, or that there are no currently visible columns
        Default:
        @com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.property.TObjectProperty(parse=false)

      • selectionModelProperty

        public abstract TObjectProperty selectionModelProperty
         TableView Class
 
  The SelectionModel provides the API through which it is possible to select single or multiple items within a TableView, as well as inspect which items have been selected by the user. Note that it has a generic type that must match the type of the TableView itself
        Default:
        @com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.property.TObjectProperty(parse=false)

      • focusModelProperty

        public abstract TObjectProperty focusModelProperty
         TableView Class
 
  Represents the currently-installed TableView.TableViewFocusModel for this TableView. Under almost all circumstances leaving this as the default focus model will suffice
        Default:
        @com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.property.TObjectProperty(parse=false)

      • editableProperty

        public abstract TBooleanProperty editableProperty
         TableView Class
 
  Specifies whether this TableView is editable - only if the TableView, the TableColumn (if applicable) and the TableCells within it are both editable will a TableCell be able to go into their editing state
        Default:
        @com.tedros.fxapi.annotation.property.TBooleanProperty(parse=false)

      • editingCellProperty

        public abstract TReadOnlyObjectProperty editingCellProperty
         TableView Class

        Default:
